intro: Calandrinia crassifolia, commonly known as the thick-leaved purslane, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy plant in arid environments. Calandrinia crassifolia is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental appeal.
